meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to the mountains, she is slowly acclimatising to the thin air.
meanings.sent2: The tropical bird is acclimatising well to the cooler weather in its new home.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried acclimatising to the desert but quickly realized it was a mistake.
meanings.sent4: Like a chameleon acclimatising to different colors, she blends into her surroundings effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: His body was acclimatising to the high altitude, making each breath feel easier.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming accustomed to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: The acclimatising of the plants to the arid conditions took time but was successful.
meanings.sent2: During the acclimatising period, the explorers learned to cope with the extreme temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The acclimatising of the fish to the colder water was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: Her acclimatising to the bustling city life was like watching a caterpillar turn into a butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The acclimatising of the team to the new coach's strategies led to improved performance.
